title: Step 1: Enforce alphanumeric-only validation for pond creation names

requirements.text: Enforce an alphanumeric-only rule for pond creation names so that new ponds can only be created with names consisting of letters (A–Z, a–z) and/or numbers (0–9), rejecting any input that includes spaces, hyphens, underscores, or any punctuation/symbol characters.

quotes: for pond creation, dont allow hyphens,  spaces, underscores or punctuation, only letters and/or numbers.
Want me to try Step 1 with that exact wording?

acceptanceCriteria: In the Create Pond UI (frontend/src/pages/CreatePondPage.tsx), entering a pond name containing any non-alphanumeric character (e.g., "funny frogs", "funny-frogs", "funny_frogs", "funny!", "frog#1") prevents submission and shows a clear validation message in English.
In the Create Pond UI, entering a pond name containing only letters and/or numbers (e.g., "FunnyFrogs", "Frogs123") allows submission to proceed.

On the backend (backend/main.mo), the createPond update method rejects (traps) when the provided pond name contains any non-alphanumeric character, ensuring validation cannot be bypassed by calling the canister directly.

The frontend no longer derives or submits a hyphenated slug (e.g., using spaces-to-hyphens conversion) for the pond name parameter; it must submit the validated alphanumeric-only pond name (optionally lowercased, but still strictly alphanumeric).
No canister state migration is required; existing ponds are unaffected, and only new pond creation is restricted.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other frontend immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Do not implement tag validation in this step (tags will be handled in a later step).
Do not change pond editing flows (e.g., editPondSettings) unless they directly create/rename a pond identifier.
Do not alter existing pond names already stored on the backend.
